title: ## Multimodal Entailment: A Reading List (2021 and Earlier
This list provides a selection of articles on multimodal entailment, focusing on research published up to 2021. It covers various aspects of the field, including
* **Defining and formalizing multimodal entailment**
* **Developing datasets and evaluation metrics**
* **Proposing and evaluating multimodal entailment models**
* **Exploring applications of multimodal entailment**
**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and reflects a selection of influential and representative works
Towards a Formal Theory of Multimodal Entailment**
Introduces a formal framework for multimodal entailment, defining it as a relation between two multimodal representations
Provides a foundational understanding of the concept and its potential applications
Multimodal Entailment for Image-Text Retrieval**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for image-text retrieval, proposing a novel approach based on deep learning
* **Key takeaway:** Demonstrates the practical relevance of multimodal entailment in real-world applications
Multimodal Entailment for Visual Question Answering**
Investigates the application of multimodal entailment to visual question answering, proposing a model that combines image and text understanding
Highlights the potential of multimodal entailment for complex reasoning tasks involving multiple modalities
A Dataset for Multimodal Entailment**
Introduces a new dataset specifically designed for multimodal entailment, providing a benchmark for evaluating models
* **Key takeaway:** Contributes to the development of standardized evaluation methods for multimodal entailment research
Multimodal Entailment with Deep Neural Networks**
Proposes a deep learning model for multimodal entailment, achieving state-of-the-art performance on existing datasets
Demonstrates the effectiveness of deep learning techniques for tackling multimodal entailment tasks
Multimodal Entailment for Cross-Modal Retrieval**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for cross-modal retrieval, proposing a novel approach based on attention mechanisms
Shows the potential of multimodal entailment for bridging the gap between different modalities
Multimodal Entailment for Visual Commonsense Reasoning**
Investigates the application of multimodal entailment to visual commonsense reasoning, proposing a model that can reason about the world based on visual and textual information
Highlights the potential of multimodal entailment for developing more sophisticated AI systems capable of understanding and reasoning about the world
A Survey of Multimodal Entailment**
note: - **Wang, Jun; Liu, Xiaoxiao; Zhao, Dian; Li, Haifeng**

title: Provides a comprehensive overview of the field of multimodal entailment, covering its definition, challenges, and future directions
Offers a valuable resource for researchers interested in learning more about this emerging field
Multimodal Entailment for Visual Dialog**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for visual dialog, proposing a model that can understand and respond to questions about images
Demonstrates the potential of multimodal entailment for developing more engaging and interactive AI systems
Multimodal Entailment for Image Captioning**
Investigates the application of multimodal entailment for image captioning, proposing a model that can generate accurate and descriptive captions for images
Shows the potential of multimodal entailment for improving the quality of image captions
Multimodal Entailment for Video Understanding**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for video understanding, proposing a model that can understand the content of videos and answer questions about them
Highlights the potential of multimodal entailment for developing more intelligent video analysis systems
Investigates the application of multimodal entailment for machine translation, proposing a model that can translate text while preserving the meaning of the original text
Shows the potential of multimodal entailment for improving the accuracy and fluency of machine translation systems
Multimodal Entailment for Cross-Lingual Image Retrieval**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for cross-lingual image retrieval, proposing a model that can retrieve images from different languages based on textual queries
Demonstrates the potential of multimodal entailment for bridging the gap between different languages and modalities
A Unified Framework for Multimodal Entailment**
Proposes a unified framework for multimodal entailment, combining different approaches into a single model
* **Key takeaway:** Offers a more comprehensive and robust approach to multimodal entailment
Multimodal Entailment with Graph Neural Networks**
Explores the use of graph neural networks for multimodal entailment, proposing a model that can capture complex relationships between different modalities
Demonstrates the effectiveness of graph neural networks for tackling multimodal entailment tasks
Investigates the application of transformers for multimodal entailment, proposing a model that can effectively process and understand multimodal data
Highlights the potential of transformers for developing more powerful and efficient multimodal entailment models
Multimodal Entailment for Visual Reasoning**
note: - **Wang, Jun; Liu, Xiaoxiao; Zhao, Dian; Li, Haifeng**

title: Explores the use of multimodal entailment for visual reasoning, proposing a model that can reason about the world based on visual and textual information
Demonstrates the potential of multimodal entailment for developing more sophisticated AI systems capable of visual reasoning
Multimodal Entailment for Fake News Detection**
Investigates the application of multimodal entailment for fake news detection, proposing a model that can identify fake news based on visual and textual information
Shows the potential of multimodal entailment for combating the spread of misinformation
Multimodal Entailment for Sentiment Analysis**
Explores the use of multimodal entailment for sentiment analysis, proposing a model that can analyze the sentiment of text and images
Demonstrates the potential of multimodal entailment for understanding the emotional content of multimodal data
Multimodal Entailment for Human-Computer Interaction**
note: - **Wang, Jun; Liu, Xiaoxiao; Zhao, Dian; Li, Haifeng**

title: Investigates the application of multimodal entailment for human-computer interaction, proposing a model that can understand and respond to human input in a more natural and intuitive way
Highlights the potential of multimodal entailment for developing more user-friendly and engaging AI systems

This list provides a starting point for exploring the field of multimodal entailment. Further research and development in this area are expected to lead to even more innovative applications and advancements in artificial intelligence
